availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Burch (Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand, pvt 24th KY Inf USA, Bath Co Rangers, and First Reg Cap Guards)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Virginia native. Farmhand in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 24th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861, to December 15, 1862. Served in Captain Busseyâ€™s Bath County Rangers as a private from December 11, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in the First Regiment Capital Guards, Frankfort Battalion, as a private from February 1, 1864, to February 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 58.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 194-95, 760, 887.
